keyEvents.title: Thousand Sunny Unveiled
keyEvents.description: The completed Thousand Sunny is unveiled to the Straw Hat Pirates by Iceburg, showcasing its magnificent lion figurehead and advanced features.
keyEvents.significance: The debut of the ship that will become the Straw Hats' home for the rest of their journey.

keyEvents.title: Soldier Dock System Revealed
keyEvents.description: The ship's innovative Soldier Dock System is introduced, featuring six rotating chambers with specialized vehicles and equipment.
keyEvents.significance: Introduces one of the ship's key features that will be used throughout future adventures.

description: The Thousand Sunny is a brigantine-style ship built from rare Adam wood, featuring a lion figurehead representing the 'King of Beasts'. It is at least twice the size of the Going Merry and packed with advanced technology including the Soldier Dock System, Coup de Burst emergency acceleration system, and sixteen cannons. The ship has a lawn deck with swing and slide, an observation tower with crow's nest, and various rooms to accommodate the crew.

notableFeatures.description: Six rotating chambers controlled from the steering wheel, each housing specialized vehicles: Channel 0 (paddle wheels), Channel 1 (Shiro Mokuba I), Channel 2 (Mini Merry II), Channel 3 (Shark Submerge III), Channel 4 (Kurosai FR-U IV), Channel 5 (Brachio Tank V), and Channel 6 (inflatable pool).
Emergency acceleration device that uses three barrels of cola to fire a cannon downward, rocketing the ship 1 kilometer into the air for rapid escape.
The ship's distinctive lion figurehead houses the Gaon Cannon, one of the ship's most powerful weapons. Represents the 'King of Beasts' philosophy.
Built from the strongest and rarest wood in the One Piece world, purchased by Franky on the black market.
The deck features a lawn area with a swing, slide, and recreational space for the crew.
The ship is equipped with sixteen cannons total: seven conventional cannons on each side, the Gaon Cannon in the figurehead, and the Coup de Burst cannon astern.

historicalEvents.description: The Thousand Sunny was secretly constructed by Franky with help from Iceburg and Galley-La Company workers, using the money the Franky Family had stolen from the Straw Hats.

trivia: The ship was initially referred to as the 'King of Beasts' at its unveiling. It was officially named 'Thousand Sunny' in Episode 322.
Franky used the 200,000,000 Berries stolen from the Straw Hats to purchase the Adam wood needed to build the ship.
The ship is powered by cola, reflecting Franky's own cola-based energy system.

keyEvents.title: The Great Underwear Chase
keyEvents.description: Franky chases the Franky Family through Water 7's streets in pursuit of his stolen swim briefs, causing destruction to several buildings.
keyEvents.significance: A chaotic and comedic scene showcasing the city's tolerance for unusual events.

description: Water 7 is a city of water built on top of sunken ruins, known as the world's premier shipbuilding city. It features a unique canal system and water elevators called Yagara Bulls for transportation.
geography: Island city with extensive canal system
climate: Temperate with periodic Aqua Laguna storms

keyEvents.title: Franky Launched to Scrap Island
keyEvents.description: Franky is forcibly launched via cannon from Water 7 to Scrap Island, followed by Luffy.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up the location for Luffy's recruitment offer to Franky.

keyEvents.title: Luffy's Bargain for Franky
keyEvents.description: On Scrap Island, Luffy offers to return Franky's swim briefs in exchange for joining the crew.
keyEvents.significance: The climactic recruitment scene takes place on this island.

description: Scrap Island is a small island near Water 7 where the Franky Family stores scrap materials and wrecked ships. It serves as their base of operations and workspace.
geography: Small island with piles of scrap metal and ship parts
